issue.title: [C++] Arrow tests should have label "arrow"
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3248](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3248). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It would help executing only them, not Parquet unit tests which for some reason are quite a bit longer to run.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3248?focusedCommentId=16710394) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I think the easiest thing would be to add a `ADD_CORE_TEST` function that applies the "arrow" prefix/label and passes through the rest of the arguments unmodified.

See https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/gandiva/CMakeLists.txt#L140 – though this can likely be even simpler

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3248?focusedCommentId=16715800) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
